In all this Ambrose was more concerned about the religious dimension than were his contemporaries on the Roman see. Damasus required from the Emperor that the strong hand of the state should assist the Church in bringing into effect the ecclesiastical jurisdiction and measures of organisation. Siricius, his successor, imitated the imperial style of governing when he replaced the usual admonitory manner of speaking by a leadership imposing itself through decrees
